metadata.title: CVE-2017-17915 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
In GraphicsMagick 1.4 snapshot-20171217 Q8, there is a heap-based buffer over-read in ReadMNGImage in coders/png.c, related to accessing one byte before testing whether a limit has been reached. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-17915` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.27-3
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.27-3
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.27-3
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.27-3
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.27-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.27-3').
